marketNews.title: üìù Kompilasi Kinerja Emiten 2024: Part 1
marketNews.content:
26 March 2025 ‚Äì The compilation of 2024 issuer performance (Part 1) summarizes the financial results of issuers that are closely related to consumers, covering the banking, consumer staples, dairy, poultry, retail, tobacco, healthcare, and media sectors. The section presents revenue, operating profit, and net profit for each sector. The key takeaways note that overall consumer-related sectors performed well in 4Q24 and FY24, with top-line growth above +6% YoY in both periods. Operating profit margin remained relatively stable, resulting in a total operating profit increase of +5.6% YoY in 4Q24 and +7.2% YoY in FY24. Margin compression in consumer staples, dairy, retail and tobacco was offset by gains in banking and poultry. Net profit fell ‚Äì1.6% YoY in 4Q24, driven by foreign-exchange losses at consumer-staples firm $ICBP and higher provisions at several banks, but FY24 net profit grew +4.8% YoY, led by banking, poultry and dairy.

Highlights per industry: ‚Ä¢ Banking remained the largest net-profit contributor in FY24, driven mainly by $BBCA (+13% YoY) and $NISP (+19% YoY), while the other three big banks posted only +0-3% YoY. Credit growth was strong for BBCA and $BMRI, both exceeding FY24 guidance, whereas $BBRI‚Äôs provision surge made it the only big bank with a cost-of-credit worse than its guidance. ‚Ä¢ Poultry posted the highest YoY net-profit growth in FY24, helped by a 5% YoY drop in average corn prices and price increases of DOC (+28% YoY) and broiler (+3% YoY). ‚Ä¢ Media, healthcare and dairy also posted double-digit net-profit growth in FY24. ‚Ä¢ Consumer staples (notably $UNVR) and tobacco saw net-profit declines due to lower volumes, higher excise and down-trading.

marketNews.title: Tax filing deadline extended to 11 April 2025
marketNews.content: The Directorate General of Taxes announced on Wednesday, 26 March 2025 that the filing deadline for individual income tax returns (SPT) has been extended from 31 March 2025 to 11 April 2025, due to the long holiday period of Nyepi and Lebaran (25 March-7 April 2025).

marketNews.title: President Prabowo says Indonesia will join New Development Bank
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto said on Tuesday, 25 March 2025 that Indonesia will join the New Development Bank, a multilateral bank created by BRICS members. He claimed membership will accelerate Indonesia‚Äôs economic transformation. Former Brazilian President Dilma Rousseff said the bank is interested in collaborating on renewable energy, biodiesel and technology projects, and noted that the president had presented dozens of potential partnership projects.

tickerNews.title: BBNI appoints new President Director and declares 8.8% dividend yield
tickerNews.content: $BBNI shareholders approved on Wednesday, 26 March the replacement of the board and commissioners, appointing Putrama Wahju Setyawan as President Director, replacing Royke Tumilaar, and Alexandra Askandar as Vice President Director (formerly Vice President at $BMRI). The RUPS also approved a 2024 dividend of roughly IDR 14 trillion (IDR 374 per share), implying an 8.8% dividend yield and a 65% payout ratio, the highest in the company‚Äôs history and above the 50-60% guidance. The cum-date and payment date were not disclosed.

tickerNews.title: BMRI posts 3.6 trillion February 2025 net profit, 7.8% YoY
tickerNews.content: $BMRI reported a net profit (bank-only) of IDR 3.6 trillion in February 2025, up 7.8% YoY but down 11% MoM. The 2-month (2M25) bank-only net profit reached IDR 7.6 trillion (+6% YoY), beating the consensus 2025F of +3.5% YoY. The bank-only credit cost stayed low at 0.68% (vs 0.88% in 2M24), better than the FY25 guidance of 1-1.2%. Credit growth was +19.1% YoY in 2M25, with the loan-to-deposit ratio falling to 92.5% (vs 98.8% in 12M24). Net interest margin slipped to 4.21% (vs 4.52% in 2M24), the lowest since 1M22 and below the FY25 guidance of 5-5.2%.

tickerNews.title: Bloomberg: Grab in talks for up to US$2 billion loan to fund GoTo acquisition
tickerNews.content: Bloomberg reported that Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) is in talks to obtain a loan of up to US$2 billion to support a potential acquisition of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia. The report said the deal could be worth more than US$7 billion, with Grab conducting due-diligence and discussing deal structure, although GoTo declined to comment.

tickerNews.title: DBS leads bid for controlling stake in PT Panin Bank (PNBN)
tickerNews.content: DBS Group (SI: DBSM) is reported by Reuters to be the leading bidder to acquire a controlling stake in PT Panin Bank (PNBN). About 86% of PNBN‚Äôs shares, worth roughly US$1.8 billion, are being offered by the current owners (Gunawan family and ANZ). The sale size will depend on the final offer price, with the binding offer expected to close by late April or early May 2025, subject to market conditions.

tickerNews.title: Bukalapak launches up to IDR 1.9 trillion share buyback
tickerNews.content: Bukalapak announced a share buyback programme of up to IDR 1.9 trillion to be executed between 26 March and 25 June 2025. The company did not disclose the number of shares to be repurchased. The buyback does not require RUPS approval, following the OJK‚Äôs relaxation to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: Bangun Kosambi Sukses plans IDR 1 trillion share buyback
tickerNews.content: Bangun Kosambi Sukses announced a share buyback of up to IDR 1 trillion to be carried out from 27 March to 26 June 2025. No number of shares was disclosed. The buyback does not need RUPS approval under the OJK‚Äôs market-stability relaxation.

tickerNews.title: UNTR reports 435 Komatsu units sold in February 2025, ‚Äì19% MoM
tickerNews.content: United Tractors reported sales of 435 Komatsu heavy-equipment units in February 2025, a 19% MoM decline but +42% YoY. Cumulative 2M25 sales reached 971 units (+18% YoY), 21.1% of the 2025 target of 4,600 units, with market share falling to 26% (vs 29% in 1M25 and 30% in 2M24). In the mining-contractor segment, UNTR produced 21.5 million tonnes of coal (+3.9% YoY) in 2M25, with over-burden removal of 168.3 million bcm (-8.5% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PTRO‚Äôs subsidiary acquires 15.2 million Petrosea shares
tickerNews.content: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN) through its subsidiary PT Kreasi Jasa Persada bought approximately 15.2 million PT Petrosea shares at an average price of IDR 2,419 per share on 18-19 March 2025, totaling about IDR 37 billion. The transaction raised PT Kreasi Jasa Persada‚Äôs stake from 44.234% to 44.385% in PTRO.

tickerNews.title: MEDC plans up to 407 million share buyback
tickerNews.content: Medco Energi Internasional announced a share buyback of up to 407 million shares (1.62% of the capital) with a maximum funding of IDR 820 billion, to be carried out between 26 March and 25 June 2025. The company previously completed a 100 million-share (0.398%) buyback on 24 March 2025 after board approval on 30 May 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTPP records IDR 2.9 trillion new contracts in February 2025
tickerNews.content: PT PP reported a new contract value of IDR 2.9 trillion in February 2025, a 32% YoY decline. The contracts were 46.7% road and bridge, 37.63% building, 9.34% dam, 5.94% irrigation and 0.4% oil & gas, representing 8.79% of the 2025 target.

tickerNews.title: SINI shareholders sell 72.2 million shares at IDR 1,000 each
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Singaraja Putra sold about 72.2 million SINI shares at IDR 1,000 each on 25 March 2025 to PT Autum Prima Indonesia and Hapsoro. The transaction reduced the seller‚Äôs stake from 31.22% to 16.22%, while PT Autum Prima‚Äôs holding rose from 30% to 36% and Hapsoro‚Äôs direct holding rose from 0% to 9%.

tickerNews.title: PACK shareholders sell 22.3 million shares at IDR 89 each
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama sold about 22.3 million PACK shares at IDR 89 each on 25 March 2025, raising roughly IDR 2 billion. The sale reduced PT Benson Kapital Indonesia‚Äôs stake from 5.9% to 4.5%.

tickerNews.title: RAJA President Director purchases 500,000 shares
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja, President Director of $RAJA, bought 500,000 shares at an average price of IDR 2,088 per share on 20-21 March 2025, for a total of about IDR 1.1 billion. His ownership increased slightly, remaining around 0.001% of total shares.

tickerNews.title: ENRG plans CCS/CCUS project at Arun field, Aceh
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada announced a plan to develop a carbon capture and storage (CCS) and/or carbon capture, utilization and storage (CCUS) project at the Arun field in Aceh. The company said the Arun field could store up to 16 trillion cubic feet of CO‚ÇÇ, and a feasibility study is targeted for completion in 2026.

tickerNews.title: NINE says controlling shareholders will not exercise rights issue
tickerNews.content: Techno9 Indonesia clarified to the IDX that its controlling shareholders will not exercise rights in the planned rights issue. The rights issue, which will create up to 2 million new shares (‚âà50% dilution), will be priced later; the proceeds of up to IDR 80 billion will be used for working capital. Advance Opportunities Fund will act as the standby buyer.

tickerNews.title: BDMN declares 2024 dividend of IDR 113.85 per share
tickerNews.content: Bank Danamon announced a 2024 dividend of about IDR 1.1 trillion (IDR 113.85 per share). The cum-date is 9 April 2025 (regular and negotiation) with payment on 24 April 2025. Based on the closing price of IDR 2,400, the implied dividend yield is 4.7%.

tickerNews.title: ACST plans up to 5 billion rights issue, up to 28% dilution
tickerNews.content: Acset Indonusa announced a rights issue of up to IDR 5 billion (approximately 39% of the share capital) that could dilute existing shareholders by up to 28%. The issue price was not disclosed. The standby buyer will be PT Karya Supra Perkasa. The rights issue will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders‚Äô meeting on 2 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: EXCL sets 16 April 2025 merger date with Smartfren, announces 3.8% dividend yield
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata announced that the effective date of the merger with Smartfren Telecom is 16 April 2025. Shareholders who do not vote in the extraordinary general meeting on 25 March 2025 may sell their shares to the company at IDR 2,350 per share, with the sale form due by 10 April 2025 and payment by 16 April 2025. In a separate corporate action, EXCL will distribute a 2024 dividend of about IDR 1.1 trillion (IDR 85.7 per share), implying a 3.8% dividend yield. The cum-date is 11 April 2025 (regular and negotiation) with payment on 24 April 2025.

tickerNews.title: SINI shareholders sell 72.2 million shares at IDR 1,000
tickerNews.content: Singaraja Putra shareholders sold about 72.2 million SINI shares at IDR 1,000 each on 25 March 2025 to PT Autum Prima Indonesia and Hapsoro. The transaction reduced the seller‚Äôs stake from 31.22% to 16.22%, while PT Autum Prima‚Äôs holding rose from 30% to 36% and Hapsoro‚Äôs direct holding rose from 0% to 9%.

tickerNews.title: RAJA President Director purchases 500,000 shares
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja, President Director of $RAJA, bought 500,000 shares at an average price of IDR 2,088 per share on 20-21 March 2025, totaling about IDR 1.1 billion. The purchase increased his holding to roughly 0.001% of total shares.

tickerNews.title: NINE confirms controlling shareholders will not exercise rights issue
tickerNews.content: Techno9 Indonesia (NINE) clarified to the IDX that its controlling shareholders will not exercise their rights in the planned rights issue. The rights issue, which could create up to 2 million new shares (‚âà50% dilution), will have a maximum raise of IDR 80 billion. Advance Opportunities Fund will act as the standby buyer.

tickerNews.title: BDMN declares 2024 dividend of IDR 113.85 per share
tickerNews.content: Bank Danamon (BDMN) will distribute a 2024 dividend of about IDR 1.1 trillion (IDR 113.85 per share). The cum-date is 9 April 2025 (regular and negotiation) with payment on 24 April 2025. Based on the closing price of IDR 2,400, the implied dividend yield is 4.7%.

tickerNews.title: ACST rights issue up to IDR 5 billion, 28% potential dilution
tickerNews.content: Acset Indonusa (ACST) plans a rights issue of up to IDR 5 billion (approximately 39% of the share capital) that could dilute existing shareholders by up to 28%. The issue price was not disclosed. The standby buyer will be PT Karya Supra Perkasa. The rights issue will be discussed at the extraordinary shareholders‚Äô meeting on 2 May 2025.
